message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DS, cs.NE 

This paper deals with natural language processing and machine learning techniques applied to linguistic data. Specifically, it focuses on the interaction between word embeddings and part of speech boundaries, which falls under the scope of computational linguistics (cs.CL). The paper also uses classifiers to predict PoS tags based on embeddings, which is a common task in machine learning (cs.LG, cs.AI). Additionally, the paper analyzes the distributional patterns of words in vector space, which is a topic of interest in data science (cs.DS). Finally, the paper discusses the notion of "soft" or "graded" part of speech affiliations, which could be relevant to neural networks and fuzzy logic (cs.NE).
